articles.title: Will Zalatoris, Matt Fitzpatrick emerge with lead at U.S. Open; Jon Rahm stumbles on 18
articles.description: Will Zalatoris and Matt Fitzpatrick emerged atop the leaderboard at the U.S. Open on Saturday during a brutal round in which eight players had at least a share of the lead at some point.
articles.content:
BROOKLINE, Mass. -- Will Zalatoris and Matt Fitzpatrick avoided the carnage and calamity that took down golf's best Saturday at a U.S. Open that set the tone for a final day of survival.

articles.title: Justin Thomas denied free drop after tee shot lands near drain during third round of U.S. Open

articles.title: Mexico City sets world record after 14,299 attend mass boxing class
articles.description: Fifteen current and former Mexican fighters helped teach the 14,299 attendees at the biggest mass boxing class in history.
articles.content:
Fifteen current and former Mexican fighters got together to teach the largest boxing class ever at the Zocalo, the main square in Mexico City on Saturday.

articles.title: Washington Wizards' Bradley Beal says little about free agency but wrist making progress
articles.description: Wizards star Bradley Beal has a player option for next season but was tight-lipped when asked about his contract situation as the start of free agency looms.
articles.content:
In a couple weeks, Bradley Beal's future might look a lot clearer.
At this point, the Washington star isn't tipping his hand.

articles.title: Milwaukee Brewers designate outfielder Lorenzo Cain, 36, for assignment after 'a great career'
articles.description: Before their game against the Reds in Cincinnati, veteran outfielder Lorenzo Cain, 36, was designated for assignment on Saturday by the struggling Milwaukee Brewers after posting a batting average of .179 in 145 at-bats this season.
articles.content:
Milwaukee Brewers outfielder Lorenzo Cain was designated for assignment on Saturday, the team announced before its game against the Cincinnati Reds.

articles.title: Sources - Kenny Atkinson won't take Charlotte Hornets job, will stay with Golden State Warriors
articles.description: After agreeing to be the Hornets' next head coach, Kenny Atkinson has changed his course and will remain an assistant with the Warriors, sources told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski.
articles.content:
Kenny Atkinson has decided he won't become the Charlotte Hornets' head coach and instead will remain with the Golden State Warriors as the top assistant, sources told ESPN's Adrian Wojnarowski.
